FINDINGS: Around the periphery of the image, there is a well-circumscribed opacity with regular margins and homogeneous density. This finding suggests a benign fibroadenoma or a benign fat necrosis (BIRADS 2). However, in the central part of the image, there are multiple scattered microcalcifications with irregular shapes and sizes. These findings suggest a suspicious area that requires short-term follow-up to confirm stability (BIRADS 3). No mass or architectural distortion is visible.
